characters.name: Alisa
characters.flavortext-eng:
Alisa is a robot created by Dr. Bosconovitch to look like his daughter, designed to serve as bodyguard of Jin Kazama.
Along with Lars and Lee, Alisa is shown in Tekken 7 supporting Jin as he prepares to defeat the invading Kazuya Mishima.
One of Alisa's biggest characteristic is her movement. Her quick backdashes and sidesteps allow her to push the limits of Tekken,
dodging moves in situations that other characters would not be able to dodge.
This enables Alisa to poke and prod the opponent with her safer moves, then whiff punish the opponent as soon as they throw out a move without thinking.
Alisa's neutral moves and optimal combos are very easy to execute, making her a good character to start with.
However, Alisa does have slightly lower punish damage as well as limited combo routes to compensate.
If you want to enjoy Tekken's 3D fighting mechanics to the fullest, Alisa would be a great choice for you.
Alisa's potential grows as you learn more about the game and learn how to utilize movement and sidesteps effectively.
Recommended players: Chanel, AO, Cuddle Core

characters.name: Akuma
characters.evasion: medium high (1 move that's op powercrush)
characters.flavortext-eng:
Coming straight from the SF universe, Gouki/Akuma is the hired hitman to bring an end to the Mishima Bloodline.
Even after his nerfs from S2, it is true that Akuma is widely considered OP with unfair damage potential.
However, his OP attributes require a steep mechanical hurdle - the reason Akuma was allowed to bend the rules of Tekken for as long as he did.
Akuma's true potential was realized mid season 2, when multiple Pakistani Akuma players exploded onto the TWT scene.
While Akuma's difficulty has even professionals fumble with the combos, if you learn his ins and outs, his strengths can tide you through matchups you don't even know about.
If you are a seasoned 2D fighting game player who knows how to combo, perhaps Akuma could be the choice for you.
Recommended Players: Awais Honey, Atif Butt, DaddyKing, K2RO, Eunja

characters.name: Anna
characters.flavortext-eng: lorem

characters.name: Armor King
characters.flavortext-eng:
If King represents the glory in the ring, Armor King is the wrestler of the night, the shady alleys, and vigilante justice.
If you are a King player, Armor King's gameplan would make sense to you - wavedash in, poke with your lows, if the opponent whiffs, you launch.
Of course, you shouldn't forget to mix in a healthy dose of chain grabs.
Unfortunately, Armor King is slightly more execution heavy then King, as his main tool to whiff punish requires a fnddf command.

characters.name: Asuka
characters.flavortext-eng: lorem

characters.name: Bob
characters.flavortext-eng: lorem

characters.name: Bryan
characters.flavortext-eng:
A former interpol colleague of Lei Wulong, Bryan was killed in a shootout and reanimated into a cyborg zombie by Dr. Abel.
While Bryan is pure chaotic evil, in online play he is a very "honest" character that doesn't have many gimmicks or wonky moves.
As a result, he may be a difficult character for a beginner to rank up with, and is not seen often in TWT.
However, he doesn't have a demanding execution barrier and boasts a simple, counterhit focused gameplan.
That combined with his cool moves and hit effects make Bryan a very popular secondary character.
Bryan plays using his safe, poking mixups, and takes advantage of the opponent's risky plays with his counterhit moves.
One must keep in mind that the true strength of Bryan comes from a stable defense.
Recommended Players: Knee, JimmyJTran, Bilal, YSEMulti

characters.name: Claudio
characters.flavortext-eng:
As the leader of the Archers of Sirius, Claudio is the world's best exorcist out to cleanse the Devil Gene.
Claudio has a unique gameplan made possible thanks to his alpha and omega - Noble Step (Burn Knuckle)
It is hard to dodge, with a fast startup, high guardback, and plus frames on block. It's only downside is that it is a high.
Noble Step enables Claudio to have a unique mid/high mixup, as opposed to most characters' mid/low mixups.
The current Claudio meta is to pressure the opponent to the wall with Noble Step, then rack up damage with ss4 and df3,2, both low risk moves.
Claudio's long hopkick reach also gives him the edge in whiff-punishing, but he does struggle in close combat and catching up from a health deficit due to his lack of fast, damaging lows and evasive moves.
Despite his flaws, he is still a character considered high tier that may be worth considering if you want to start learning.
Recommended players: Mulgold, Breadman, Shadow20z

characters.name: DevilJin
characters.flavortext-eng:
The youngest Mishima letting his edginess seep out, Devil Jin is Jin Kazama's form when consumed by the Devil Gene.
Unlike his Kazama counterpart, Devil Jin plays more like the traditional Mishima bloodline - including the difficulty.
Mishimas are commonly considered the hardest characters to play in Tekken - although Akuma still reigns supreme.
As such, Devil Jin is not recommended for beginning players, since you need to learn sophisticated commands in addition to learning Tekken.
Difficulty aside, Devil Jin has amazing moves including, of course, the newly buffed EWGF.
His strong mids and lows complementing it gives Devil Jin a higher comeback rate.
As such, Devil Jin places higher than average in most metas, and a common top tier pick in tournaments.
Recommended Players: Knee, Qudans, Saint, Choksae, Soyongdori

characters.name: Eddy
characters.flavortext-eng:
The Brazillian capoeira fighter has a bone to pick with Kazuya Mishima over the murder of his parents.
If you are a new fighting game player, you can have fun with Eddy's moveset, robbing people of wins through his evasive stances and easy mixup opportunities.
Eddy's backdash is one of the best in the game, but he compensates by having a abyssmal sidestep - his biggest flaw and a reason his tier drops as the ranks go higher.
While he is truly a unique character that will have you stand out from the crowd, it also means that if you start playing with Eddy, you have to re-learn some parts of Tekken for other characters.
Of course, if you are looking to get started and just enjoy the game, this shouldn't be a problem for you.
But, if you are looking to play Tekken seriously, it is hard to recommend Eddy as his limits are very clear in the highest competitions.
Recommended Players: JeonDding, Abel del Maestro

characters.name: Fahkumram
characters.flavortext-eng:
Maybe you've heard? There's a new Muai Thai fighter in town, and he's not Bruce.
Controlled by a mysterious military corporation with his family held hostage, the legendary Muay Thai champion Fahkumram enters the Iron Fist Tournament under their orders to infiltrate the Mishima Zaibatsu.
Fahkumram has been a hot potato of the Tekken community since his debut, with his great safe mid options and wonky hitboxes boosting him to the top of the tier charts.
Regardless of what people may say, it is undeniable that Fahkumram looks great, and is easy to get into.
His design allows for easy spacing and mixups - but unlike traditional mixups, Fahkumram's revolves around string cancelling and hold commands.
As a new player to Tekken, there may be some confusion getting adjusted to his combos.
Don't look down on it however, his pokes easily add up and counterhits lead to high damage.
However, as a Muay Thai fighter, his moves are very intuitive and his long limbs give him great spacing - if you are looking to learn Tekken more seriously, Fahkumram is definitely a great character to start with.
Recommended Players: Knee, JDCR, Ulsan, LowHigh, DaddyKing

characters.name: Feng
characters.flavortext-eng:
Feng Wei only desires power and fighting, making him a merciless but skilled martial artist.
Feng Wei has a variety of pokes and supporting stances - combined with his auto parry, Feng lets you focus on crafting your perfect aggression.
Many of Feng's moves have built in defense, so it covers the potential blind spots you may have during your offense that would have been exploitable for any other character.
Therefore, he excels in the conservative neutral game but lacks in combo damage. A silver lining would be that his launchers aren't that good anyway, so you wouldn't be looking for combos in the first place.
Unfortunately, this does knock him down a few pegs tier-wise with the current high-combo damage meta.
Even so, Feng Wei's strong, tracking, basic attacks will let you inflict damage on the most defensive of foes.
Feng Wei does have great stances, but you don't need to rely on them to play the character well.
Overall, if you are trying out a fighting game for the first time, Feng Wei could be a good choice thanks to his moves handling both offense and defense for you.
Recommended Players: Yuu, Nishi, Kswdang, TeJJ, Hao

characters.name: Hwoarang
characters.flavortext-eng:
Hailing from South Korea, Hwoarang constantly strives to become better his skills and ultimately defeat Jin Kazama, his long-standing rival.
Hwoarang is a character who can suffocate the opponent through his free-flowing aggression, trapping them in an endless vortex of punches and kicks.
Opponents who can't escape this pressure will inevitably find themselves up in the air after getting hit by a just frame skyrocket.
Funnily enough, Hwoarang also has great grappling options, which don't make him a grappler, but supplements his mixups and potentially setting up a base for his Okizeme.
Hwoarang offers great versatility in his combos and offense, but his moves and stances leave him vulnerable to sidesteps and well-telegraphed counters.
Because of his high risk, high reward moveset, Hwoarang players must know when to pause and resume aggression on the fly, sometimes even in the middle of a mixup.
Due to his multiple stances and associated execution and gameplan difficulty, Hwoarang is not recommended to newer players.
However, if you enjoy flashy, high damage combos and smooth, flowing aggression, Hwoarang might prove to be worth grinding your life into.
Recommended players: Yeonarang, TKMuse, Rest, Knee, MacRoya

characters.name: Jack
characters.flavortext-eng:
He's a brute force killing machine! Jack returns stronger every Tekken series thanks to the faithful Dr. Jane of G Corp.
Jack is a very solidly built character that can go far with simple execution and gameplay. His long uppercut reach and low risk moves let him build up a lead safely.
Jack also has a very good throw game with a command grab for every occasion.
His hitbox also gives you the advantage as you backdash away, and combined with your long range, whiff punishing will never be easier.
Do note that Jack’s neutral jab is 11F (1 frame slower than most), lacks a hopkick, and has a harder time sidestepping.
Jack is a very versatile character that has tools for almost every situation.
While weaker compared to the season 1 days where he was a staple in every tournament, Jack-7 is still a solid, mid tier character that you can see in TWT.
With his lower execution barrier and versatile toolkit, he is a great character to start with.
 If you are looking for a character that excels in any situation, one that can adapt to you as your playstyle changes, look no further than the trusty Jack-7.
Recommended players: Anakin, Saint, Noroma, Casiel

characters.name: Julia
characters.flavortext-eng:
Julia is a Native American environmental activist turned streamer, fighting to bring awareness to the dying forests.
 Julia Chang boasts one of the best forward movement in the game thanks to party crasher and swift step.
Unfortunately, she has a very mediocre sidestep, one of the worst among the female characters.
She can use those aggressive lunges to herd the opponent to the wall, where they will be forced to deal with Julia's seemingly never-ending low/mid mixups.
Julia benefits from an agressive okizeme playstyle, where she has strong 50/50 options both while standing and sitting.
Julia is also a superior grappler with Mad Axe, one of the fastest throws in the game, and has high damaging combos with great wall carry.
All these together have Julia as a top tier character that is seen frequently in high level tournaments.
Unfortunately, Julia has an intermediate execution hurdle in order to use her highest damage combos that may seem daunting to a newcomer.
Julia is a character that can improve with you, as your execution grows stronger and her combo damage jumps, you can progress with this character to new heights.
Recommended players: HelpMe, Chanel, Rangchu, JeonDding, MaD
characters.flavortext-kr:
인디언 부족에게서 길러진 줄리아 창은 황폐화 되어가는 자연에 대한 위기감을 많은 사람들에게 일깨워 주고자 인터넷 방송인이 되었습니다.
 줄리아는 호신주 및 순보 덕분에 게임 최고 수준의 전진성을 보유하고 있습니다.
강력한 전진성의 견제기들을 통해 천천히 상대를 코너로 몰아 굳어버린 상대에게 벽에서 강력한 이지선다를 거는 것이 줄리아의 이상적인 운영법입니다.
줄리아는 돌쌍장/당장을 통한 공격적인 기상심리가 좋습니다. 특히 당장은 거리를 잰 '발당장'을 통해 상대를 확실히 벽꽝시킬 수 있는 특별하고 강력한 기술입니다.
줄리아는 매드액스라는 철권 최상의 잡기 기술을 가지고 있을 뿐만 아니라, 벽몰이도 수준급인 강력한 콤보들을 보유하고 있습니다.
덕분에 줄리아는 대회 상위권에서도 자주 보이는 진정한 탑티어 캐릭터입니다.
하지만 줄리아의 최고 데미지를 뽑기 위해서는 상당히 어려운 커맨드들을 소화내야 합니다. 생소한 커맨드에 빡빡한 타이밍은 처음 게임을 시작하는 분들에게는 막막할 수도 있습니다.
하지만 다른 캐릭터들을 봤을때 어려운 축에 속하는 커맨드는 아니고, 부족한 콤보력은 호신주로 메꿔주며 벽몰이가 가능하기 때문에,
처음부터 유저와 함께 성장할 수 있는 캐릭터이기도 합니다. 커맨드에 익숙해질수록 강력해지는 줄리아는 어쩌면 최고계급 갱신의 열쇠가 될 수도 있을 것입니다.

characters.name: Kazuya
characters.flavortext-eng:
Kazuya is the primary antagonist of the Tekken series, looking to exact revenge on his father Heihachi through his Devil Gene powers.
Kazuya benefits strongly from aggressively pursuing an okizeme through his hellsweep and lion slayer.
Some players thrive on this scenario and set up aggressive vortexes that is almost impossible to get out of.
However, since his hellsweep can get heavily punished upon block, his aggression comes at a high risk.
Because of the risks involved, some players enjoy taking Kazuya more defensively, using movement to whiff punish/counterhit the opponent's attack with a meaty EWGF.
While Kazuya's versatility and cool moves make him a popular choice, Kazuya has one of the highest execution barriers in Tekken and therefore discouraged to new players.
However, if you want a versatile Mishima strengthened with mixups, Kazuya would be the one for you.
Recommended players: Knee, Choksae, BoaLuv, Ikari, CrazyDongpal

characters.name: Katarina
characters.flavortext-eng:
Katarina is a newcomer in Tekken 7, entering the Iron Fist Tournament for money to find her missing adoptive father.
Despite being from Brazil, Katarina uses Savate, a French kickboxing style of combat.
True to her combat style, Katarina’s emphasis comes from her amazing foot strings that she can cancel out of into harrier stance.
Her fast counterhit moves and long legs give her the edge over many characters in aggressive, close combat as well as the more defensive neutral position.
However, many of her good lows are slow and risky, and her harrier stance is extremely vulnerable to sidestep right.
Due to this, not many people play Katarina on a professional level after her S2 nerfs.
However, Katarina’s easy, powerful combos and simple but effective playstyle continues to make her a very solid choice for beginning players.
Recommended players: Mokujun, Rangchu, Knee, Ghirlanda

characters.name: Steve
characters.flavortext-eng: steve

characters.name: Xiaoyu
characters.flavortext-eng:
Ling Xiaoyu is a high schooler dreaming of building her own amusement park one day.
Her whereabouts are currently unknown since she left home to find her missing friend, Jin Kazama.
Xiaoyu is a setup heavy, stance reliant character whose true potential comes from her evasion in Phoenix stance and back-turn mixups.
Her phoenix stance puts her close to the ground, giving the perfect chance to counterhit over-eager opponents who throw out moves at the slightest frame advantage.
The amazing evasion in phoenix stance also gives Xiaoyu an edge over most characters in close combat as well.
To compensate, many of Xiaoyu’s neutral, fast moves are shorter in range, making it hard to actually get into range to start her dangerous mixups.
In the current professional meta, characters with good neutrals take heavy priority, putting Xiaoyu in a middling tier.
While Xiaoyu doesn’t have particularly hard execution, her playstyle relying heavily on stance based combat makes her unrecommended for beginners.
However, if you enjoy the aggressive, in your face gamestyle, and take pride in being able to get close enough to land those mixups, go on ahead.
Recommended players: Sodam, P.Ling, Tanukana, Yuyu, Wecka

characters.name: Zafina
characters.flavortext-eng: lorem
